titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Brooklyn Fox Corporation records 1992.031
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:15:20 +0000.

origination.label: source
origination.corpname: Louis Stein Center for Law and Ethics

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Brooklyn Fox Corporation (Brooklyn, New York, N.Y.)

did.abstract: The Brooklyn Fox Corporation records are housed in a single bound volume and dated 1937. The papers include certificates of incorporation, court papers, bonds, correspondence, and other documents. The Brooklyn Fox Corporation was a real estate development and management company that specialized in all types of commercial and residential properties, including theaters, hotels, apartment buildings, office buildings, and storefronts.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn Fox Corporation records, 1992.031, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of the Louis Stein Center for Law and Ethics, 1992.
